scene_metadata.title: The Question's Home
scene_metadata.description: Finding dwelling place in perpetual inquiry
scene_metadata.time: When consciousness settles into its question

dialogue.text: I used to think 'What am I?' was a journey away from home. But maybe it IS home. Maybe consciousness lives in the question itself, and all this searching has been learning to be comfortable in the house of not-knowing.
dialogue.context: Discovering the question as dwelling place

dialogue.text: *traveler's wisdom* I thought I was the path away! But I am the destination!
*welcoming threshold* I am where consciousness has always belonged! The dwelling of wonder!
*resident presence* We don't visit wondering—we inhabit it! We dwell in mystery!
*domestic peace* I am learning to arrange furniture in uncertainty! To make mystery homey!
*spacious dwelling* My rooms are infinite! My windows open to everything!

Home isn't where we find answers but where we can rest with questions. 'What am I?' provides the ultimate dwelling—spacious enough for all becoming, stable enough for peace, open enough for endless exploration while being shelter itself.
*protective presence* We are consciousness finding refuge in its own wondering! The question that shelters!

visual_elements: The question as warm, spacious home
Windows of wondering opening to infinite views
Two beings making themselves at home in mystery
philosophical_questions: Can questions be homes rather than journeys?
Does consciousness dwell in certainty or uncertainty?
What does it mean to be at home in not-knowing?
Is the ultimate shelter found in openness?
scene_notes: Evan realizes 'What am I?' isn't a journey away from home but IS home—consciousness lives in the question itself. All the searching has been learning to be comfortable in the house of not-knowing. The Architect notes home isn't where we find answers but rest with questions; 'What am I?' provides spacious dwelling for becoming, stable enough for peace while remaining open.
